title: JSON schema for Travis CI configuration files
description: The root node of your build config.

filter_secrets.summary: Whether to filter secrets from the log output

trace.summary: Whether to trace the build script

addons.title: Addons
addons.description:
Build addons enable additional built-in functionality, such as
installing build dependencies, system setup tasks, and integrations
with external services.

arch.title: Architecture
arch.description: The architecture that will be selected for the build environment.

archs.title: Architectures
archs.description: The architectures that will be selected for the build environments.

branches.title: Branches
branches.description:
Include or exclude branches for your build to be run on.

This is a legacy setting, use the more powerful condition (`if`) to define branches for your build to be run on.
branches.summary: Include or exclude branches from being built

cache.title: Cache

edge.summary: Whether to use an edge version of the cache tooling

cache.summary: Cache settings to speed up the build

condition.title: If
condition.description:
Include or exclude builds, stages, and jobs by specifying conditions in your
build configuration. These are evaluated when your build is being configured.
condition.summary: Condition to determine whether or not a build, stage, or job should be run

global.summary: Global environment variables to be defined on all jobs

matrix.summary: Environment variables that expand the build matrix (i.e. that create one job per entry)

source.summary: The source to import build config from

mode.summary: How to merge the imported config into the target config

imports.title: Imports
imports.description:
Import YAML config snippets that can be shared across repositories.

See [the docs](...) for details.

osx_image.summary: OSX image to use for the build environment

before_install.summary: Scripts to run before the install stage

install.summary: Scripts to run at the install stage

before_script.summary: Scripts to run before the script stage

script.summary: Scripts to run at the script stage

before_cache.summary: Scripts to run before storing a build cache

after_success.summary: Scripts to run after a successful script stage

after_failure.summary: Scripts to run after a failing script stage

before_deploy.summary: Scripts to run before the deploy stage

after_deploy.summary: Scripts to run after the deploy stage

after_script.summary: Scripts to run as the last stage

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.summary: Notification targets to notify on build results

services.title: Services
services.summary: Services to set up and start

sudo.title: Sudo
sudo.deprecated: this key has no effect anymore

apt.title: Apt
apt.description: Install APT packages and sources without using apt-get commands in a before_install script manually.

artifacts.title: Artifacts
artifacts.description:
Automatically upload your build artifacts to Amazon S3 at the end of a build, after the `after_script` phase.

Please see [our documentation](https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/uploading-artifacts/) for details.

bucket.summary: The S3 bucket to upload to

endpoint.summary: The S3 compatible endpoint to upload to

paths.summary: Paths to the files to upload

artifacts.summary: Upload build artifacts at the end of the build

forcelocal.summary: Force all network traffic to be resolved via the build environment VM

only.summary: Restrict local testing access to the specified local servers/directories
